newsitem.title: ESTONIA: INTERBANK RATES DOWN IN HIGH MONEY SUPPLY.
newsitem.headline: INTERBANK RATES DOWN IN HIGH MONEY SUPPLY.

text.p: rates fell on Wednesday, the central bank said.
Erkki Raasuke, head of Hansapank's interest rate products
and financial risk department, said the rates fell due a high
supply of funds on the market.
Local banks have received some foreign credits and there is
also some influence from foreign speculators, Raasuke said.
He said some foreign players had bet that interest rates
would rise in Estonia in the wake of the attacks on the Czech
currency but that no rate rise took place and kroons were
